questions.question_text: How does a zone-based firewall implementation handle traffic between interfaces in the same zone?

choices.C: Traffic between interfaces in the same zone is always blocked
choices.A: Traffic between two interfaces in the same zone is allowed by default
choices.B: Traffic between interfaces in the same zone is blocked unless you apply a service policy to the zone pair

choices.C: The switch could be allowed to join the VTP domain
choices.B: The switch could become the root bridge

questions.question_text: An attacker installs a rogue switch that sends superior BPDUs on your network. What is a possible result of this activity?
questions.answer: D. The switch could become a transparent bridge
questions.answer_ET: D. The switch could become a transparent bridge

choices.A: It supports a more complex encryption algorithm than other disk-encryption technologies
